text: The Billy Graham Center was founded and opened in 1981 on the campus of Wheaton College. Named after Billy Graham, the center is the main place for many of Wheaton College's bible and theology classes. There are eleven areas of work focused on "Stimulating Global Evangelism" with 25-40 staff, carrying out the work. == Other websites == *Official Billy Graham Center website Category:Christian organizations based in the United States Category:1981 establishments in the United States
title: Billy Graham Center
